description:
Trametes versicolor FP-101664 SS1 is a fungal species that belongs to the Basidiomycota phylum. It is a wood-rotting fungus commonly known as the "turkey tail" or "Coriolus" mushroom. This particular strain, FP-101664 SS1, is a specific isolate or variant of the Trametes versicolor species.

Trametes versicolor is known for its distinctive, multicolored, fan-shaped fruiting bodies that grow on the surface of decaying wood. The caps of the fruiting bodies exhibit a range of colors, including shades of brown, orange, yellow, and white, often in concentric patterns. This unique appearance is the source of the species' common name, "turkey tail."

The FP-101664 SS1 strain of T. versicolor has been the subject of scientific research, particularly in the field of biotechnology and medicine. This strain has demonstrated potential therapeutic properties, such as the ability to modulate the immune system and exhibit anti-tumor activity. Researchers have investigated the potential applications of this fungal species in the development of novel drugs and therapeutic treatments.

It is important to note that the scientific understanding and potential applications of Trametes versicolor FP-101664 SS1 are based on ongoing research and may be subject to further investigation and validation by the scientific community.
